docs.title: The Ethical Researcher's Guide to Using AI Tools
docs.text:
Welcome to the comprehensive guide for using AI tools responsibly in academic research.

Workshop Materials

This website accompanies the workshop presented by Dr. Awara Bakhtiyar Rasool and Davar Adil Yassin at Salahaddin University-Erbil.

docs.title: 🎯 What You'll Learn
docs.text:
• AI Tools Overview

    Explore ChatGPT, Claude, Gemini, NotebookLM, DeepSeek, and more

    AI Tools

  • Prompt Engineering

    Master the CARE framework for effective AI prompts

    Learn Prompting

  • 11 Research Tasks

    Copy-paste prompts for gap finding, outlines, literature review & more

    Browse Tasks

  • Ethics & Integrity

    Avoid hallucinations, plagiarism, and ethical pitfalls

    Stay Ethical

docs.title: 🚀 Quick Start
docs.text:
1. Choose Your AI Tool → AI Tools Overview
  2. Learn Prompt Engineering → CARE Framework
  3. Find Your Task → 11 Research Tasks
  4. Copy & Customize the prompt for your needs

docs.title: ⚠️ Important Reminders
docs.text:
AI is an Assistant, Not a Replacement

  • You remain the author and are responsible for all content
  • Always verify AI-generated information
  • Never copy-paste without critical review
  • Cite your sources - AI cannot reliably provide real citations

Salahaddin University-Erbil College of Administration and Economics 2026

docs.title: AI Tools Overview
docs.text: A guide to the main AI tools available for academic research.

docs.title: ChatGPT (OpenAI)
docs.text:
Feature Details Best For Writing, brainstorming, code Cost Free (GPT-3.5) / $20/mo (GPT-4) Special Deep Research Mode URL chat.openai.com

Deep Research Mode

Searches the web and synthesizes comprehensive reports. Great for literature overviews!

docs.title: Claude (Anthropic)
docs.text: Feature Details Best For Long documents, nuanced writing Cost Free tier / $20/mo Pro Special 200K context window URL claude.ai

docs.title: Gemini (Google)
docs.text: Feature Details Best For Research, multimodal tasks Cost Free / $20/mo Advanced Special Deep Research Mode URL gemini.google.com

docs.title: DeepSeek
docs.text:
Feature Details Best For General assistance Cost Completely FREE Special No usage limits URL deepseek.com

Budget-Friendly Option

DeepSeek rivals ChatGPT quality and is completely free with no limits!

docs.title: NotebookLM (Google)
docs.text:
Feature Details Best For Analyzing your own papers Cost FREE Special AI-generated audio podcasts! URL notebooklm.google.com

Upload your PDFs and get:

  • 🎙️ Audio podcasts about your research
  • 📝 Summaries and study guides
  • ❓ Q&A from your sources only

docs.title: z.ai (Zotero)
docs.text:
Feature Details Best For Reference management Cost Subscription Special Zotero integration URL z.ai

Chat with your entire Zotero library!

docs.title: Perplexity
docs.text: Feature Details Best For Real-time research Cost Free / Pro Special Citations for every claim URL perplexity.ai

docs.title: Which Tool for Which Task?
docs.text:
Task Recommended Tool Brainstorming titles ChatGPT, Claude Literature overview Gemini Deep Research Analyzing your papers NotebookLM Free alternative DeepSeek Cited web search Perplexity Reference management z.ai + Zotero

Remember

No single tool is perfect. Experiment to find what works best for your workflow!

docs.title: Prompt Engineering
docs.text: Master the art of writing effective prompts to get better results from AI.

docs.title: The CARE Framework
docs.text:
CARE = Context + Action + Result + Example

The most effective prompts follow this structure.

docs.title: 1. Context 🎯
docs.text:
Provide background information:

  • Your role (student, researcher)
  • Your field/domain
  • The situation

Good Context

"I am a Master's student in Marketing at Salahaddin University researching social media's impact on consumer behavior in the Kurdistan Region."

docs.title: 2. Action ✏️
docs.text:
Clearly describe what you want:

  • Be specific about the task
  • Include constraints
  • Specify any requirements

Good Action

"Identify 5 potential research gaps in this area from recent literature (2020-2024)."

docs.title: 3. Result 📋
docs.text:
Describe the desired output:

  • Format (table, bullet points, essay)
  • Length (word count, number of items)
  • Style (academic, casual)

Good Result

"For each gap, provide: description, significance, 2-3 research questions, and suggested methodology. Present in a structured format with clear headings."

docs.title: 4. Example 💡
docs.text:
When possible, provide:

  • Sample outputs
  • Reference materials
  • Models to follow

Good Example

"Here's an example of the format I need: [paste example]"

docs.title: Complete CARE Prompt Example
docs.text:
Act as an academic researcher specializing in Digital Marketing. 
I am a Master's student interested in studying social media marketing 
in the Kurdistan Region.

Analyze recent literature (2020-2024) and identify 5 potential 
research gaps. For each gap, provide:
- The gap description (what is missing)
- Why it matters (significance)  
- 2-3 potential research questions
- Suggested methodology

Focus on understudied contexts, populations, or variable combinations. 
Present in a structured format with clear headings.

docs.title: Quick Tips
docs.text: Do ✅ Don't ❌ Be specific and detailed Be vague ("help me with my thesis") Specify the format you want Accept whatever format AI gives Ask for sources/citations Trust citations without verifying Iterate and refine Accept first output as final Provide context about yourself Assume AI knows your situation

docs.title: Chain of Thought
docs.text: Ask AI to "think step by step" for complex problems.

docs.title: Role Assignment
docs.text: Start with "Act as a [expert type]" to get specialized responses.

docs.title: Output Constraints
docs.text: Specify exact formats: "Provide as a numbered list of exactly 5 items."

docs.title: Clarification Request
docs.text: End prompts with: "If you need any clarification, ask me before proceeding."

docs.title: Resources
docs.text: Additional tools and references for AI-assisted research.

docs.title: General Purpose
docs.text: Tool URL Cost ChatGPT chat.openai.com Free / $20/mo Claude claude.ai Free / $20/mo Gemini gemini.google.com Free / $20/mo DeepSeek deepseek.com Free

docs.title: Research-Specific
docs.text: Tool URL Best For NotebookLM notebooklm.google.com Analyzing your papers Perplexity perplexity.ai Web search with citations z.ai z.ai Zotero integration Connected Papers connectedpapers.com Visualize paper connections Semantic Scholar semanticscholar.org AI-powered paper search

docs.title: Reference Management
docs.text: Tool URL Notes Zotero zotero.org Free, open-source Mendeley mendeley.com Free with Elsevier integration EndNote Commercial University may provide

docs.title: Writing & Editing
docs.text: Tool URL Purpose Overleaf overleaf.com Online LaTeX editor Grammarly grammarly.com Grammar checking

docs.title: Academic Databases
docs.text: Database URL Google Scholar scholar.google.com ResearchGate researchgate.net Academia.edu academia.edu JSTOR jstor.org

docs.title: Workshop Materials
docs.text:
• 📊 Download Presentation (PDF)
  • 🌐 GitHub Repository

Workshop by Dr. Awara Bakhtiyar Rasool & Davar Adil Yassin Salahaddin University-Erbil 2026

docs.title: Ethical Guidelines
docs.text: Using AI responsibly in academic research.

docs.title: OECD AI Principles
docs.text:
The internationally recognized framework for ethical AI:

  1. Transparency - Be clear about AI use
  2. Accountability - You remain responsible
  3. Fairness - Avoid biased outputs
  4. Privacy - Protect data
  5. Human Control - AI assists, doesn't replace you

docs.title: ✅ Acceptable Uses
docs.text:
• Brainstorming and ideation
  • Grammar and style checking
  • Code assistance and debugging
  • Learning concepts
  • Summarizing your own uploaded papers

docs.title: ❌ Unacceptable Uses
docs.text:
• Submitting AI-written text as your own
  • Using AI to complete assignments without disclosure
  • Fabricating data or citations
  • Bypassing plagiarism detection

docs.title: 1. Disclose AI Use
docs.text:
Be transparent about how you used AI in your research process.

Sample Disclosure

"ChatGPT (GPT-4) was used for brainstorming research questions and improving grammar. All content was written by the author and verified independently."

docs.title: 2. Maintain Authorship
docs.text:
• You are the author
  • You are responsible for accuracy
  • You must verify all information

docs.title: 3. Critical Review
docs.text:
Never accept AI output without:

  • Reading it carefully
  • Verifying claims
  • Rewriting in your own voice
  • Checking for factual errors

docs.title: The Bottom Line
docs.text:
Golden Rule

AI is a tool, not a co-author. Use it to enhance your work, but ensure everything you submit is your own verified work that you fully understand.

docs.title: AI Hallucinations
docs.text: Understanding and avoiding AI-generated misinformation.

docs.title: What are Hallucinations?
docs.text:
Definition

AI Hallucinations are confidently stated false information that AI generates as if it were true.

AI can:

  • Invent fake citations and papers
  • Create non-existent authors
  • Generate plausible but false statistics
  • Make up quotes

docs.title: Fake Citations
docs.text:
❌ AI says: "Smith & Johnson (2023) found that..."

✅ Reality: This paper doesn't exist!

docs.title: Fake Statistics
docs.text:
❌ AI says: "According to a 2024 WHO report, 78% of..."

✅ Reality: No such report exists!

docs.title: 1. Always Verify Citations
docs.text:
• Search every citation on Google Scholar
  • Check if the authors and journal are real
  • Verify the publication year and DOI

docs.title: 2. Cross-Check Facts
docs.text:
• Use multiple sources
  • Don't trust statistics without original source
  • Verify quotes by searching the exact text

docs.title: 3. Use Grounded Tools
docs.text:
• NotebookLM - Only uses your uploaded sources
  • Perplexity - Provides citations for claims
  • Upload real PDFs rather than asking AI to find them

docs.title: The Golden Rule
docs.text:
Trust but Verify

Never include any AI-generated citation, statistic, or quote in your research without independently verifying it first.

docs.title: 11 Research Tasks AI Can Assist With
docs.text: AI can help with many aspects of your research workflow. Here are 11 key tasks organized by research phase.

docs.title: 📋 Planning Phase
docs.text: # Task Description 1 Gap Finding Identify unexplored areas in existing literature 2 Title Generation Brainstorm research titles and refine scope 3 Research Outline Generate complete thesis/dissertation structure 4 Research Questions Develop RQs and hypotheses

docs.title: 📚 Research Phase
docs.text: # Task Description 5 Literature Review Organize and summarize research papers 6 Novel Concepts Create new definitions and frameworks 7 Article Comparison Compare papers systematically

docs.title: 📊 Analysis Phase
docs.text:
# Task Description 8 Data Analysis Get help with statistics and code 9 Visualization Create charts, diagrams, and posters 10 Reference Management Format and organize citations 11 LaTeX Formatting Create professional documents

Critical Reminder

AI is an assistant, not a replacement. You remain the author and are responsible for all content.

docs.title: How to Use These Prompts
docs.text:
1. Click on any task to see the detailed prompt
  2. Copy the prompt to your clipboard
  3. Replace the placeholders (text in [BRACKETS]) with your information
  4. Paste into your AI tool (ChatGPT, Claude, Gemini, etc.)
  5. Review and iterate on the output

Each task page includes:

  • ✅ What the task is
  • ✅ Why it matters
  • ✅ A ready-to-use prompt
  • ✅ Tips for best results

docs.title: Task 7: Article Comparison
docs.text: Systematically compare multiple research papers across key dimensions.

docs.title: Comparison Dimensions
docs.text:
• Research objectives
  • Methodology/sample
  • Theoretical framework
  • Key findings

docs.title: 📋 Copy This Prompt
docs.text:
Act as an academic reviewer. I will provide you with two research paper 
abstracts. Compare them systematically on these dimensions:

- Research objectives and questions
- Theoretical/conceptual framework
- Methodology and sample characteristics
- Key findings and conclusions
- Limitations acknowledged

Present your analysis in two formats:
1. A comparison table with the dimensions as rows
2. A 5-sentence synthesis paragraph highlighting key similarities 
   and differences

[PASTE YOUR TWO ABSTRACTS HERE]

docs.title: Tips for Best Results
docs.text:
Upload PDFs

Upload full PDFs to ChatGPT or Claude for more accurate comparison than using just abstracts.

Pro Tip

Use this to build your literature review synthesis section!

docs.title: Task 8: Data Analysis Assistance
docs.text: Get help with statistical test selection, code generation, and results interpretation.

docs.title: AI Can Help With
docs.text:
• Choosing the right test
  • Writing SPSS/Python/R code
  • Interpreting outputs
  • Creating APA tables

docs.title: Tools to Use
docs.text:
• ChatGPT Code Interpreter - Run Python analysis
  • Claude - Upload data files
  • Gemini - Statistical explanations

docs.title: 📋 Copy This Prompt
docs.text:
Act as a statistical consultant. I have survey data with these variables:

- Independent: [YOUR IV] (Likert 1-5)
- Dependent: [YOUR DV] (Likert 1-5)
- Moderator: [YOUR MODERATOR] (categorical: [CATEGORIES])

I want to test if [IV] affects [DV], and if [MODERATOR] moderates 
this relationship.

Provide:
1. The appropriate statistical test and why
2. SPSS syntax to run this analysis
3. How to interpret the key outputs
4. How to report the results in APA format

docs.title: How to Customize
docs.text:
Placeholder Replace with [YOUR IV] Your independent variable [YOUR DV] Your dependent variable [YOUR MODERATOR] Your moderating variable [CATEGORIES] The categories (e.g., "18-25, 26-35, 36+")

Important

You must understand the statistical concepts. AI helps with execution, not learning!

docs.title: Task 1: Gap Finding
docs.text: Identify unexplored or under-researched areas in existing literature.

docs.title: What is a Research Gap?
docs.text: An unexplored or under-researched area in existing literature where your research can contribute new knowledge.

docs.title: Why It Matters
docs.text:
• ✅ Justifies your research
  • ✅ Shows originality
  • ✅ Guides your focus
  • ✅ Required in thesis proposals

docs.title: 📋 Copy This Prompt
docs.text:
Act as an academic researcher specializing in [YOUR FIELD]. 
I am a Master's student interested in studying [YOUR TOPIC] 
in the Kurdistan Region.

Analyze recent literature (2020-2024) and identify 5 potential 
research gaps. For each gap, provide:

- The gap description (what is missing)
- Why it matters (significance)
- 2-3 potential research questions
- Suggested methodology

Focus on understudied contexts, populations, or variable combinations. 
Present in a structured format with clear headings.

docs.title: How to Customize
docs.text:
Replace the placeholders:

Placeholder Replace with [YOUR FIELD] e.g., "Digital Marketing", "Human Resource Management" [YOUR TOPIC] e.g., "social media marketing", "employee motivation"

docs.title: Tips for Best Results
docs.text:
Be Specific About Context

Mention your specific location/context (Kurdistan Region, Iraq, developing countries) to find gaps relevant to your situation.

Verify Everything

AI may suggest gaps that don't actually exist. Always verify by searching Google Scholar.

docs.title: Task 11: LaTeX Formatting
docs.text: Create professional academic documents using LaTeX.

docs.title: What is LaTeX?
docs.text: A professional document preparation system used for academic papers, especially those with equations, tables, and figures.

docs.title: Why Use LaTeX
docs.text:
• Professional typesetting
  • Automatic formatting
  • Better equations
  • Required by many journals

docs.title: 📋 Copy This Prompt
docs.text:
Convert the following text into a professional LaTeX document:

[PASTE YOUR TEXT HERE]

Requirements:
- Use article document class
- Include proper sections and subsections
- Format any tables professionally using booktabs
- Include a bibliography section
- Add appropriate figure placeholders where images are mentioned

Provide the complete .tex file content.

docs.title: Basic Structure
docs.text:
\documentclass{article}
\usepackage{booktabs}

\title{Your Title}
\author{Your Name}
\date{\today}

\begin{document}
\maketitle

\section{Introduction}
Your content here...

\end{document}

docs.title: Online Editors
docs.text:
• Overleaf - overleaf.com (Free, collaborative)
  • TeXLive - Full installation for your computer

AI + Overleaf

Use AI to generate LaTeX code, then paste it into Overleaf to compile and preview!

docs.title: Task 5: Literature Review Assistance
docs.text: Organize, summarize, and find patterns across multiple research papers.

docs.title: What AI Can Do ✅
docs.text:
• Summarize papers
  • Organize by themes
  • Track chronological trends
  • Compare methodologies

docs.title: What AI Cannot Do ❌
docs.text:
• Access real databases
  • Verify citations
  • Replace critical reading
  • Guarantee accuracy

docs.title: 📋 Copy This Prompt
docs.text:
Act as an academic researcher. I am conducting a literature review on 
[YOUR TOPIC].

Analyze the key themes in this research area from 2020-2024. 
For each theme:
- Identify the main focus and scope
- List key authors and seminal papers
- Describe common methodologies used
- Note any gaps or inconsistencies in findings

Present your findings in a table with columns: 
Theme Name, Key Focus, Main Authors, Common Methods, Research Gaps. 
Include at least 5 themes.

Critical Warning

AI may generate fake citations! Always verify every reference using Google Scholar before including in your work.

docs.title: Tips for Best Results
docs.text:
Upload Real Papers

For accurate summaries, upload your actual PDFs to ChatGPT, Claude, or NotebookLM rather than asking AI to find papers.

docs.title: Task 6: Novel Concept Generation
docs.text: Create new definitions, frameworks, or conceptual combinations for original contributions.

docs.title: Types of Novelty
docs.text:
• New definitions
  • Combined frameworks
  • Extended theories
  • New constructs

docs.title: 📋 Copy This Prompt
docs.text:
Act as a theoretical researcher. I want to create a novel concept that 
combines [CONCEPT 1] with [CONCEPT 2] in the context of [YOUR CONTEXT].

Develop:
- A new term or concept name
- A formal academic definition (2-3 sentences)
- Theoretical justification explaining why this combination is meaningful
- How it differs from existing concepts in the literature
- 3 potential research questions using this concept

Use formal academic journal language throughout.

docs.title: How to Customize
docs.text:
Placeholder Replace with [CONCEPT 1] e.g., "social media marketing" [CONCEPT 2] e.g., "cultural identity theory" [YOUR CONTEXT] e.g., "the Kurdistan Region"

Critical

You MUST rewrite AI-generated concepts in your own words. Never copy-paste!

docs.title: Task 10: Reference Management
docs.text: Format, convert, and organize citations in the correct style.

docs.title: AI Can Help With
docs.text:
• Converting citation styles
  • Formatting references
  • Finding missing info
  • Alphabetizing lists

docs.title: Common Styles
docs.text:
• Harvard (SUE standard)
  • APA 7th Edition
  • IEEE, Chicago, MLA
  • Journal-specific styles

docs.title: 📋 Copy This Prompt
docs.text:
Act as a citation expert specializing in Harvard referencing style. 
Convert the following references to Harvard format:

[PASTE YOUR REFERENCES HERE]

For each reference:
- Format according to Harvard style guidelines
- Ensure author names are: Surname, Initial.
- Italicize journal/book titles appropriately
- Include DOI or URL where available

Then alphabetize the complete list, remove any duplicates, 
and flag any entries with missing information.

SUE Standard

Harvard referencing is the official style at Salahaddin University-Erbil.

docs.title: Tips for Best Results
docs.text:
Use Zotero

For best results, use Zotero for reference management and z.ai to enhance it with AI.

docs.title: Task 3: Research Outline
docs.text: Generate a complete, structured thesis or dissertation outline based on your research title.

docs.title: Why It Matters
docs.text:
• ✅ Provides research roadmap
  • ✅ Ensures logical structure
  • ✅ Saves planning time
  • ✅ Identifies all sections needed

docs.title: 📋 Copy This Prompt
docs.text:
Act as an academic thesis advisor. Based on the following research title, 
generate a complete Master's thesis outline:

Title: [PASTE YOUR TITLE HERE]

Provide a comprehensive outline including:
- All chapters with numbered sections/subsections
- Brief description of each section's content
- Suggested word count per chapter
- Key components for Literature Review & Methodology
- Expected tables/figures for each chapter

Format as a hierarchical structure (1, 1.1, 1.1.1). 
Total target: 15,000-20,000 words.

docs.title: How to Customize
docs.text: Placeholder Replace with [PASTE YOUR TITLE HERE] Your complete research title

docs.title: Example Output Structure
docs.text:
The AI should generate something like:

Chapter 1: Introduction (2,000-2,500 words)
  1.1 Background of the Study
  1.2 Problem Statement
  1.3 Research Objectives
  1.4 Research Questions
  1.5 Significance of the Study
  1.6 Scope and Limitations
  1.7 Structure of the Thesis

Chapter 2: Literature Review (4,000-5,000 words)
  2.1 Theoretical Framework
    2.1.1 Theory 1
    2.1.2 Theory 2
  2.2 Conceptual Review
    2.2.1 Variable 1
    2.2.2 Variable 2
  ...

docs.title: Tips for Best Results
docs.text:
Be Specific About Requirements

Mention your university's specific requirements if you have them (e.g., minimum chapters, required sections).

Use for Planning

This outline becomes your roadmap - share it with your supervisor for feedback early!

docs.title: Task 4: Research Questions & Hypotheses
docs.text: Generate clear, testable research questions and hypotheses that guide your study.

docs.title: Why It Matters
docs.text:
• ✅ Focuses your research
  • ✅ Determines methodology
  • ✅ Required in proposals
  • ✅ Guides data collection

docs.title: 📋 Copy This Prompt
docs.text:
Act as a research methodology expert. Based on my research title:

Title: [PASTE YOUR TITLE HERE]

Generate comprehensive research questions and hypotheses:
- 1 Main Research Question (broad, overarching)
- 3-5 Specific Sub-Questions (measurable, focused)
- Corresponding Null & Alternative Hypotheses for each
- Identify IV, DV, and mediating/moderating variables

Format: RQ1, RQ1a, RQ1b... with H0/H1 pairs. 
Ensure all are testable and aligned with quantitative/qualitative methodology.

docs.title: How to Customize
docs.text: Placeholder Replace with [PASTE YOUR TITLE HERE] Your complete research title

docs.title: Example Output
docs.text:
Main Research Question:
RQ1: To what extent does social media marketing influence 
     consumer purchase intentions in the Kurdistan Region?

Sub-Questions:
RQ1a: What is the relationship between social media engagement 
      and brand awareness?
RQ1b: How does perceived authenticity of social media content 
      affect purchase intention?

Hypotheses:
H1: Social media engagement has a significant positive effect 
    on brand awareness.
    H0: Social media engagement has no significant effect on 
        brand awareness.

Variables:
- Independent Variable (IV): Social media marketing activities
- Dependent Variable (DV): Consumer purchase intention
- Mediator: Brand awareness
- Moderator: Age group

docs.title: Tips for Best Results
docs.text:
Match to Methodology

Specify whether you're doing quantitative, qualitative, or mixed methods - the RQs should align.

Review with Supervisor

RQs and hypotheses are foundational - get supervisor approval before proceeding.

docs.title: Task 2: Title Generation
docs.text: Brainstorm research titles, refine topic scope, and generate thesis ideas.

docs.title: Why It Matters
docs.text:
• ✅ Saves brainstorming time
  • ✅ Explores different angles
  • ✅ Helps narrow your focus
  • ✅ Generates variations

docs.title: 📋 Copy This Prompt
docs.text:
Act as a thesis supervisor at a business school. Generate 10 potential 
research titles for a Master's thesis in [YOUR FIELD] focusing on 
[YOUR TOPIC].

Requirements for each title:
- Be specific and clearly researchable
- Include independent and dependent variables
- Vary the methodological approaches (quantitative, qualitative, mixed)
- Consider the Kurdistan Region context where applicable

For each title, provide a 2-sentence explanation of the potential 
contribution. Present as a numbered list.

docs.title: How to Customize
docs.text: Placeholder Replace with [YOUR FIELD] e.g., "Marketing", "Finance", "Management" [YOUR TOPIC] e.g., "digital advertising effectiveness", "employee retention"

docs.title: Tips for Best Results
docs.text:
Iterate

If you like one title direction, ask AI to generate 5 more variations of that specific angle.

Remember

Use AI titles as starting points. Always refine with your supervisor!

docs.title: Task 9: Visualization & Posters
docs.text: Create charts, graphs, diagrams, posters, and even audio explanations.

docs.title: What AI Can Create
docs.text:
• Charts & graphs (bar, line, scatter)
  • Research model diagrams
  • Conference posters
  • Audio podcasts & summaries

docs.title: Key Tools
docs.text: Tool Best For Gemini Images & figures NotebookLM Podcasts & explanations ChatGPT Python code for charts Canva AI Poster design

docs.title: 📋 Prompt 1: Generate Research Figure
docs.text:
Create a professional visualization showing the relationship between 
[VARIABLE 1] and [VARIABLE 2] across [GROUPS].

Requirements:
- Use a grouped bar chart style
- Academic-appropriate colors (blues, grays)
- Include proper labels and legend
- Make it suitable for a journal article

docs.title: 📋 NotebookLM: Generate Podcast
docs.text:
1. Go to notebooklm.google.com
  2. Upload your thesis chapter or literature review
  3. Click "Audio Overview"
  4. Get a 10-minute podcast summary of your research!

Amazing Feature

NotebookLM creates a two-person conversation explaining your research - great for understanding complex papers or sharing with others!
